data.title: Book Ray, Jr. Charles for Speaking, Events and Appearances
data.meta_description: Book Ray, Jr. Charles to speak at your next event. Contact APB Speakers for bio, videos, topics, and to inquire about speaking fees and availability.
data.text:
His international lectures on the Global Influence of Music, Film, and Poetry part 1, 2, and 3 have been enthusiastically received, most recently during another university tour in mainland China.

As founder of the non-profit, Ray Charles Jr. Foundation for America, Ray is committed to serving humanitarian causes in remembrance of his father’s lifelong commitment and legacy to community service. With a distinct emphasis on innovative educational solutions, preserving our natural resources and environment, and expanding the role of performing arts in the lives of American youth. Ray Jr. is actively involved in creating and growing ventures that support these values.

As the catalyst behind Sena Entertainment, a new online initiative, soon to be formally announced, his goal is to enhance the contribution made by creative entrepreneurs, by providing greater access, resources, and content that informs, inspires, and elevate the business savvy of these unique artistic leaders.

Ray’s film and television producing highlights include; co-executive producer of Ray Charles 50 years of Music for Fox Television; co-producer – award winning film Ray a Taylor Hackford film for Crusader Entertainment / Walden Media; co-producer – Ray Charles with the Voices of Jubilation / Christmas Jubilee Concert / DVD; co-producer and appeared in Black Prince an Anatoli Ivanov film and Grand Jury Prize award-winning film of the New York International Film Festival based on the life of Alexander Pushkin, filmed in Moscow and St. Petersburg, Russia; and co-producer –Hotel California, a Geo Santini film for Alliance Entertainment Group. Ray is currently in pre-production with Broadcast Urban Films to produce the Reginal Lewis Story the first African American billionaire.
